member.name: IPersistSerializedPropStorage.GetPropertyStorage
member.summary: Gets the serialized property storage data from the property store instance.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the address of a pointer to the serialized property storage data.
When this method returns, contains the count of bytes contained in the serialized property storage data pointed to by ppsps.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IPersistSerializedPropStorage.SetFlags
member.summary: Toggles the property store object between the read-only and read/write state.

param.name: flags
param.para: The flags parameter takes one of the following values to set options for the behavior of the property storage:
Windows 7 and later. The property store object is read/write.
The property store object is read-only.

Introduced in Windows 8. New property values that are added to the property store through the IPropertyStore.SetValue method will cause the method to return S_OK. If this flag is not set, the addition of new property values to the property store does not affect the value returned by IPersistStream.IsDirty.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IPersistSerializedPropStorage.SetPropertyStorage
member.summary: Initializes the property store instance from the specified serialized property storage data.
member.param: A pointer to the serialized property store data that will be used to initialize the property store.
The count of bytes contained in the serialized property storage data pointed to by psps.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: IPersistSerializedPropStorage
member.summary: Exposes methods to persist serialized property storage data for later use and to restore persisted data to a new property store instance.
